summary: What is the U.S. government doing to keep nuclear weapons out of the wrong hands? The National Nuclear Security Administration implements nonproliferation programs to reduce the threat of more nations or non-state actors acquiring nuclear weapons or radiological materials for a “dirty bomb.” The agency requested about $1.5 billion for 2018 to fund these programs, but we found that they do not have complete schedule...
title: Nuclear Nonproliferation: NNSA Needs to Improve Its Program Management Policy and Practices
